THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON
06.01.2020, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING:

bieeen
Crl.MC.No.2005 OF 2019(A) 2 2020/KER/I6
ORDER
Dated this the 6th day of January 2020

Petitioners are accused 1 and 2 in Crime No.1460/2012 of
Kodungallur Police Station. There were three accused in the
crime and the petitioners were absconding and the trial
proceeded against the 3rd accused as S.T. No.2522/2012 on the
files of the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Kodungallur.
The 3â„¢ accused who faced trial was found not guilty and
acquitted by the Jurisdictional Magistrate under Section 255(1)
of Cr.P.C, vide judgment at Annexure Al dated 8.12.2017. On
appreciation of evidence let in by Pws1 and 2, it was found that
it was not reliable and there were certain discrepancies which
led to the acquittal of the 3 accused. Since accused 1 and 2
were absconding and the case against them was split up and
refiled and presently pending as S.T No.3076/2017 on the files
of the same court. The petitioner contends that in view of the
acquittal of the 3% accused, they are also entitled to similar
consideration and hence the case against them may be quashed
under Section 482 of Cr.P.C.

oR
Crl.MC.No.2005 OF 2019(A) 3 2020/KER/I6

2. A reading of Annexure Al judgment indicates that it
was on appreciation of evidence let in by witnesses that the
court below found it difficult to convict the 3 accused. On the
basis of the appreciation of evidence, it is not possible to quash
the proceedings under Section 482 of Cr.P.C. The petitioner will
have to face the trial and the extra ordinary power under Section
482 of CrP.C cannot be exercised in favour of the petitioners to
quash the proceedings in the crime.

The Crl.M.C. is therefore dismissed.

SD/-
ASHOK MENON
JUDGE
